articles.title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
articles.description: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

articles.title: ETH-BTC ratio bottomed in April, mirrors 2019 cycle: Analyst
articles.description: The Ethereum ecosystem continues to see increased development and value locked in tokenized assets, according to market analyst Michaël van de Poppe.

articles.title: India tightens KYC requirements for crypto user onboarding
articles.description: Tax and other regulatory agencies in India claim that cryptocurrencies and permissionless blockchain tech undermine tax collection.

articles.title: JPMorgan downplays stablecoin threat as local bankers warn of $6.6 trillion risk
articles.description: The ABA sent a letter to the U.S. Senate, saying stablecoins that offer yields will affect its banking members ability to grant loans, but JPMorgan disagrees.

articles.title: Elon Musks's X teases crypto-aware ‘smart cashtags’ just day after community backlash
articles.description: Nikita Bier, X’s head of product, outlined plans for asset-aware Smart Cashtags a day after criticism from parts of the crypto community over a now-deleted post.

articles.title: Ethereum treasury company BitMine crosses 1 million staked ETH milestone
articles.description: BitMine Immersion Technologies is the largest Ethereum treasury company by holdings, with over 4 million ETH in its corporate treasury.

articles.title: Monero's XMR hits $500 for the first time since 2021 as rival Zcash fumbles
articles.description: History shows XMR has repeatedly failed near record highs, risking another sharp pullback unless it decisively breaks above $500–$520.

articles.title: Walmart and Google bet on AI agents to reshape how people shop online
articles.description: The retail giant said a new Gemini integration reflects a broader shift from search-based shopping to AI systems that can act on a customer’s behalf.

articles.title: As the market tanks, crypto’s new gold rush is…gold
articles.description: The huge spike in onchain gold signals is that DeFi investors are planning to stay in DeFi, even when the tide turns, argues RAAC founder Kevin Rusher.

articles.title: Bitcoin bear market still in play as power law sees $65K 'do-or-die' price
articles.description: Bitcoin power law analysis concluded that price may face a new battle around $65,000 if BTC spends 2026 as a year of consolidation.

articles.title: Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin warns decentralized stablecoins still have deep flaws
articles.description: The Ethereum co-founder argues that price benchmarks, oracle security and staking incentives remain unresolved challenges for decentralized stablecoins.

articles.title: Ethereum’s future hinges on zero-knowledge proofs, EF director says
articles.description: In a recent interview with CoinDesk, Ethereum Foundation co-executive director Hsiao-Wei Wang described zero-knowledge as part of Ethereum’s midterm roadmap, pointing to “many amazing breakthroughs” i

articles.title: Russians ask government hotlines whether pensions are paid in crypto
articles.description: Crypto-related questions about pension payments are reaching Russia’s Social Fund hotline, suggesting digital assets are entering mainstream financial concerns.

articles.title: CryptoQuant founder slams X for penalizing crypto content instead of bots
articles.description: X’s head of product said Crypto Twitter’s reach problems are self-inflicted, blaming overposting rather than algorithmic suppression.

articles.title: Tennessee sends cease-and-desist letters to Kalshi, Polymarket, Crypto.com
articles.description: Tennessee regulator warned that failure to comply could trigger steep fines, court injunctions and potential law enforcement referrals for for further investigation.

articles.title: Samson Mow tips Elon Musk will ‘go hard’ into Bitcoin in 2026
articles.description: Jan3 founder Samson Mow’s predictions are among the more bullish outlooks compared with most recent forecasts from other crypto market participants.

articles.title: Ethereum sentiment mirrors levels seen before ‘major run’: Santiment
articles.description: Ethereum’s social media sentiment is “kind of reminiscent” of what was seen before its last major run, according to Santiment.

articles.title: Iran’s Revolutionary Guard moved $1 billion through UK-registered crypto exchanges, report finds
articles.description: The vast majority of the transactions were conducted using Tether's USDT stablecoin on the Tron network, the analysis by TRM Labs found.

articles.title: Bitcoin mining difficulty falls in first adjustment of 2026
articles.description: Bitcoin mining difficulty, which hit repeated highs in 2025, recorded a slight decline in its first network adjustment of 2026.

articles.title: Starknet publishes post-mortem report after temporary network outage
articles.description: The outage was the second major network disruption in 2025, with both incidents requiring a block reorganization that rolled back some activity.

articles.title: Robinhood explains building an Ethereum layer-2: 'We wanted the security from Ethereum'
articles.description: CoinDesk sat down with Robinhood’s head of crypto, Johann Kerbrat, to get an update on its upcoming layer-2 network, its tokenized stocks program, and its staking offerings.

articles.title: Polymarket faces first state-level cease-and-desist from Tennessee, weeks after US relaunch: report
articles.description: Tennessee's Sports Wagering Council sent cease-and-desist letters to Kalshi, Polymarket, and Crypto.com threatening potential criminal prosecution.

articles.title: Bitcoiners celebrate 17th anniversary of Hal Finney's Bitcoin post
articles.description: Many in the Bitcoin community continue to speculate that cryptographer Hal Finney was Bitcoin's pseudonymous creator, Satoshi Nakamoto.

articles.title: Bitfinex whales dump BTC longs as $135K Bitcoin price target reemerges
articles.description: Bitcoin whales began repeating a classic bull signal as they took BTC long positions off the table after a year of declining overall market exposure.

articles.title: The Senate moves toward a market structure vote: State of Crypto
articles.description: Lawmakers will (finally) vote on a market structure bill next week.

articles.title: Tennessee orders Kalshi, Polymarket and Crypto.com to cease sports betting contracts
articles.description: The firms, federally regulated by the CFTC, were told to shut down Tennessee-based activity, refund deposits, and void open contracts by Jan. 31.

articles.title: XRP ETFs hit record weekly volume as bitcoin, ether funds face $750 million in combined outflows
articles.description: The first full trading week of 2026 saw XRP and SOL ETFs log net inflows, while bitcoin and ether funds struggled in comparison.

articles.title: Brazilian exchange Mercado Bitcoin outlines 6 crypto trends shaping markets in 2026
articles.description: The stablecoin sector is expected to grow to $500 billion, while altcoin ETFs are projected to reach $10 billion, driven by regulatory clarity and adoption.

articles.title: Institutions know a “good” exchange is built for failure
articles.description: A platform's onboarding polish should not be confused for its ability to execute trades and handle immense volumes, argues Bridgeport co-founder and CCO Chris Soriano.

articles.title: Hundreds of wealthy investors are using crypto to buy real estate in Europe
articles.description: Brighty co-founder Nikolay Denisenko, a former lead backend engineer at Revolut, says his startup has brokered over 100 deals for HNWIs to buy apartments in Europe.

articles.title: Betterment urges users to ignore ‘unauthorized’ crypto promotion message
articles.description: The message claimed Betterment would “triple” Bitcoin and Ether deposits sent within hours, urging users to transfer $10,000 to crypto wallets.

articles.title: Spot Bitcoin ETFs lose $681M in first week of 2026 as risk appetite fades
articles.description: Spot Bitcoin ETFs reversed early inflows in 2026 and posted four straight days of outflows as fading rate-cut hopes and rising geopolitical risks pushed investors into risk-off positioning.

articles.title: Pump.fun says creator fees ‘may have skewed’ incentives, plans revamp
articles.description: Pump.fun is introducing a new creator fee sharing system that lets teams and CTO admins split fees across up to 10 wallets, transfer coin ownership and revoke update authority.

articles.title: Anti-DeFi group runs ads urging public to pressure Senators on crypto bill: Report
articles.description: A series of ads reportedly aired on Fox News, calling on the public to contact their senators to remove DeFi provisions from the CLARITY Act bill.

articles.title: Asset manager VanEck explains how one bitcoin could be worth $2.9 million by 2050
articles.description: The asset manager’s base case assumes bitcoin gains traction as a settlement tool and reserve asset over the next 25 years.

articles.title: A16z raises $15B, says crypto a ‘key’ to America winning next 100 years
articles.description: Crypto remains a key technology for maintaining America’s technological edge, according to a16z, which has raised another $15 billion to back American-aligned tech investments.

articles.title: A16z Crypto Shares Three Crypto Predictions for 2026
Stablecoin card adoption will be a 'big theme' of 2026: Dragonfly exec
articles.description: Crypto venture capitalists have tipped stablecoin card adoption to take off in 2026 after fintech startup Rain secured $250 million in funding to push stablecoin payments.

articles.title: Memecoin Market Cratered More Than 60% in 2025: Report
Bitcoin tests key support as bulls reset to prepare for futures-led rally to $101.5K
articles.description: Bitcoin traders’ risk sentiment turned bullish, with the proof being in this week’s futures-led advance to $95,000. Will bulls make another attempt after retesting a key underlying support level?

articles.title: Bitcoin Whales Keep Buying as 100+ BTC Addresses Set New Record
articles.description:
Bitcoin Magazine

Bitcoin Whales Keep Buying as 100+ BTC Addresses Set New Record
Bitcoin whale accumulation hit a record high as 100+ BTC addresses surged, even as bitcoin consolidates near $90,000 a

articles.title: Nasdaq, CME Group join forces to launch Nasdaq-CME Crypto Index
articles.description: Cryptocurrency index benchmarks and crypto index investment vehicles will grow in popularity as market complexity increases, analysts say.

articles.title: Should Politicians Be Able to Use Prediction Markets? House Bill Proposes Ban
articles.description: Rep. Ritchie Torres introduced legislation to ban government officials from prediction markets, citing insider information concerns.

articles.title: Colombia advances crypto tax rules as global reporting standards take shape
articles.description: New rules from Colombia’s tax authority require crypto service providers to collect and share user and transaction data.

articles.title: Senate Republicans race toward crypto vote on bill with uncertain Democratic buy-in
articles.description: The Banking Committee chief confirmed Friday evening that he's pressing forward, though the Agriculture Committee says it still hopes for a bipartisan version.

articles.title: US lawmakers demand ethics safeguards for market structure bill: Report
articles.description: Democratic leaders on key committees considering crypto market structure legislation are reportedly drawing a line in the sand over elected officials profiting off the industry.

articles.title: Wall Street’s crypto debate is over as banks go all-in on BTC, stablecoins, tokenized cash
articles.description: Big banks aren’t debating crypto anymore — they’re building it. From tokenized cash to ETFs, Wall Street is quietly going onchain.

articles.title: Insiders Say DeepSeek V4 Will Beat Claude and ChatGPT at Coding, Launch Within Weeks
articles.description: DeepSeek's upcoming V4 model could outperform Claude and ChatGPT in coding tasks, according to insiders—with its purported release nearing.

articles.title: 'Baldur's Gate 3' Game Studio Says 'Divinity' Won't Include AI-Generated Art
articles.description: Larian Studios head Swen Vincke said the upcoming RPG Divinity will not use generative AI art, though the studio still sees benefits to the tech.

articles.title: CLARITY Act hinges on bipartisan support, and here are the numbers: Analyst
articles.description: The crypto market structure bill is unlikely to come up for a second vote in 2026 if it fails to pass in a vote next week, analyst Alex Thorn said.
